title: Drawing, "Elevation of a church for Monte Vergine"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Steps lead to the door in an apse which is flanked by statues in niches. Two angels crouch beside a cross on top of the dome and before a half-circular window. Triangular pediment with an escutcheon inside, and a cross on top. Apse laterally. Written, right top corner: "Chiesa p[er] Monte/ vergina/ e guesta e la deci / di 8 Lug[li] 0 1784". Recto: variation of teh design on obverse. Unfinished.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Elevation of a church for Monte Vergine".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1137.
